DOC.brief_summary: We conduct randomize , control trial routine , pre-natal care practice-site base pre- post-natal breastfeeding promotion intervention low-income minority woman , stratification maternal country origin . Our primary outcome measure breastfeed duration extent , i.e . `` intensity . '' Our secondary outcome measure : ) infant weight , b ) participant/ provider experience intervention . The Provider Approaches Improved Rates Infant Nutrition & Growth Study ( PAIRINGS ) trial randomizes woman Prenatal Care Provider ( PNC ) + Lactation Consultant ( LC ) intervention , Control group . The PNCs use brief , computer prompt protocol throughout pregnancy follow-up maternal-infant dyad . The LC meet woman , one-on-one pregnant , daily hospital round , well-infant care ( need ) home visit . Post-partum interview 1,3 6 month collect infant feeding data . Primary Outcomes ( Hypotheses ) : Breastfeeding 1 . Breastfeeding Intensity 1,3 , 6 Months- There significant difference , treatment group , BF intensity . Intensity assess via 7 day recall frequency breastmilk feeding vs. liquid solid . 2 . Exclusive Breastfeeding 1,3 , 6 Months- There significant difference , treatment group , rate exclusive BF . Secondary Outcomes ( Hypotheses ) : Infant Growth 3 . Weight-for-Length , Breastfeeding Intensity : There significant association BF intensity weight-for-length z score 4,6,9 , 12 month well-child visit . 4 . Weight Gain , Breastfeeding Intensity : There significant association BF intensity weight gain 4th -12th month age . 5 . Weight-for-Length , Treatment Group : There significant association treatment group weight-for-length z score 4,6,9 , 12 month well-child visit 6 . Weight Gain , Treatment Group : There significant association treatment group weight gain 4th - 12th month age .
DOC.brief_title: Provider Approaches Improved Rates Infant Nutrition Growth Study
